channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8702] Make WALEditCodec pluggable
item.description:
WALEditCode needs to be pluggable to support alternative serialziation mechanisms.

The open question here is whether to support the alternative codec when doing replication - both clusters would need the codec on the classpath, which has additional overhead and also will be a little bit complicated when making the WAL serialization backwards compatible in 0.94.

This is the follow-up to HBASE-8636.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
My inclination here is to not support a custom WAL codec when doing replication, particularly for 0.94. It just adds gobs of complexity from the 'regular' case of supporting custom serialziation to the WAL. In 0.96, the HLog writing and replication serialization are completely orthogonal, even using different serialization mechanisms, lending credence to the idea that we should consider them separate in 0.94.

We would just need a big, fat disclaimer that the codec is only for the HLog, not for replication (which most people probably won't even consider as being used, at least off the bat).

Attaching patch for 0.94 that just makes the WALEditCodec pluggable for the HLog reading/writing. Passes the added test and Test*WAL*,Test*HLog*,Test*Replication*.

Working on a trunk patch (should be pretty similar).
Attaching patch for trunk (assuming should work for 0.95 too). Ran - and passed - same tests as for 0.94.

+  public static final String WAL_CELL_CODEC_CLASS_KEY = "hbase.regionserver.wal.codec";

Please don't put in HConstants...


+      WALCellCodec codec = codecClazz.newInstance();

+      codec.init(conf, compression);

ReflectionUtils::instantiateWithCustomCtor calls a custom ctor, then there's no need for init method, removing final, etc.
Btw, trunk right now doesn't handle CompressionContext very well, it has to be set for WALEdit/HLogKey (there are some TODOs there), not sure if it would have implications for custom codecs

Otherwise looks good.
Also, is it extending WALCellCodec in particular for interface, or functionality, or both?
ByteString-related methods I suppose

This message is automatically generated.

Sergey Shelukhin thanks for taking a look! Yeah, that seems like using the ReflectionUtils it would be better.

What I'm really try to get is an easy way to doing custom KeyValue (de)serialization to handle special KeyValues. Before, you basically had to completely rewrite the SequenceFileLogWriter/Reader (in 0.94). Its not as bad for 0.96 where you could use the ProtobufLogReader/Writer, but its still a unclean that way to handle custom types.

Please don't put in HConstants...

Where would you recommend putting it? Its used across a couple different classes, and right now we don't seem to have a consistent place of putting these kinds of things.

Wrt custom KVs - this is only WAL though, right? What about HFile-s?
As for the constant, usually its put in the main class, HConstants is too bloated. Main class in this case is probably WALCellCodec itself.

As for the constant, usually its put in the main class

Fair enough - I frequently find it hard to find constants if they are all over the place. HConstants is a decent enough location, but I'm happy to put it in the class too.

Wrt custom KVs - this is only WAL though, right? What about HFile-s?

I don't need it for HFiles, this is essentially about storing temporary meta-data that just needs to be replayed under certain scenarios. But having the KeyValueCodec/CellCodec there makes this completely possible to use with HFiles, if someone wanted to... but that ship already sailed with HBASE-8636, this just gives me a handle.
Trunk patch addressing Sergey's comments.

Thanks Sergey! I'm planning on committing to trunk tomorrow, unless there are objections.
Attaching patch actually committed to trunk - fixes a javadoc warning and adding a final specifier to the CompressionContext in WALCellCodec (unnecessarily removed in last patch).

This message is automatically generated.

Updated patch for 0.94. Not significantly different from the other one, just a little nit cleanup.

I didn't end up using ReflectionUtils since we don't have the HBase version in 0.94 and the stuff from Hadoop looks a bit too heavy weight - sooo its back to a nullary constructor (which you get by default anyways) and an empty init method.

In the end, this ends up being just as easy for users to implement a WALEditCodec.

I'd like to commit tonight (assuming the tests for this pass locally).
